question: 偽る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>fake</kanji> and the verb vocab version is similar, it means <vocabulary>to lie</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to cheat</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to deceive</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Someone tries <vocabulary>to lie</vocabulary> to you. You can't believe it. <reading>It's wha</reading>t (<ja>いつわ</ja>)??? You can't believe it.
